paper_abstract: We present DisVis, a Python package and command line tool to calculate the reduced accessible interaction space of distance-restrained binary protein complexes, allowing for direct visualization and quantification of the information content of the distance restraints. The approach is general and can also be used as a knowledge-based distance energy term in FFT-based docking directly during the sampling stage.
paper_title: DisVis: quantifying and visualizing accessible interaction space of distance-restrained biomolecular complexes
